intro: Dracula polyphemus, commonly known as the "Queen of the Night," is a rare and striking orchid native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is characterized by its large, velvety purple flowers with intricate patterns that resemble the face of a mythical creature. The plant thrives in high humidity and cool temperatures, often growing on the trunks of trees in shaded environments. Its unique appearance and rarity make it a highly sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts. Botanically, it belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is known for its delicate, ephemeral blooms that open at night.
